Review the specified content (a file, a PR, a section of documentation, or a code snippet) for accessibility issues. Check for:

In Markdown or documentation:

  • Heading levels that skip (e.g., h2 â†’ h4)
  • Link text that is non-descriptive ("click here", "here", "read more", bare URLs)
  • Images that lack alt text or have empty alt text on informational images
  • Tables that lack header rows
  • Lists that misuse ordered vs. unordered structure

In HTML or templates:

  • Interactive elements that are not keyboard accessible
  • Missing or incorrect ARIA labels
  • Focus management issues
  • Color used as the only means of conveying information

For each finding:

  • State the specific location (file, line, or section heading)
  • Explain the impact on a user who relies on a screen reader or keyboard
  • Suggest the specific change to resolve it
  • Reference the applicable WCAG success criterion

End with a summary count: N issues found, N high priority, N medium, N low.
